title: Department of Health Services
cleaned_text: Getting an Appointment Call 211 Sacramento at 916-529-4519 - Get connected with someone who can make a vaccination appointment for you - no computers needed! [211 Sacramento](https://www.211sacramento.org/211/) offers social service referrals in multiple languages, too. Getting a Ride to an Appointment Uber and Lyft - Riders can request free rides to get to a vaccine appointment. See their webpages: United Ways of California (UWCA) is working with United Way Worldwide and several local partners to provide free or discounted Lyft rides to Californians who would like free transportation to their COVID19 vaccine appointments. If you'd like a free ride to your vaccination appointment text the phrase VAXRIDE to the phone number 211-211. Once you text in and answer a few simple questions, we will provide you with a code that you can enter into your Lyft app to get a free or discounted ride. One person is eligible for up to four codes to help you get to your appointments for both doses of the vaccine as well as any additional booster shots. Each code will account for each of your four round-trip rides to a vaccination clinic. If you're interested in a free round trip ride to your vaccination text the phrase VAXRIDE to 211-211. These services are accessible for people with disabilities. Requests for reasonable accommodation or reasonable modification of policies, practices and procedures in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) may be made by calling 211 (CA Relay 711) or by email
